jparsec.math

Class LinearFit

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.LinearFit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LinearFit
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class for fitting data to a straight line in a very rigorous way.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  LinearFit.MAX_CORRELATION
      The set of possible variable to modify during the search for maximum correlation.

    • Method Detail

      • linearFit

        public ChartSeriesElement linearFit()
                             throws JPARSECException
        Linear fit of data. Results set to static constants and arrays. Number of points should be 2 or more, or 2 with a forced value of the slope parameter.
        Returns:
        The series representing the linear fit.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of points is lower than 2 and the slope is not forced.

      • evaluateFittingFunction

        public double evaluateFittingFunction(double x)
        Evaluate fitting line in some point. A fit should previously be done.
        Parameters:
        x - Point to evaluate.
        Returns:
        Result of evaluation. 0.0 if fit is invalid.

      • evaluateAbcissa

        public double evaluateAbcissa(double y)
        Evaluate abscissa in some point. A fit should previously be done.
        Parameters:
        y - Y point.
        Returns:
        x for f(x) = y. 0.0 if fit is invalid.

      • evaluateFittingFunctionError

        public double evaluateFittingFunctionError(double x)
        Evaluate fitting error in some point. A fit should previously be done.
        Parameters:
        x - Point to evaluate.
        Returns:
        Result of evaluation. 0.0 if fit is invalid.

      • isInvalid

        public boolean isInvalid()
        Checks if the fit is invalid.
        Returns:
        True if it is invalid.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all forced variables, setting them to false and invalid_fit value.

      • getInvalidPoints

        public int[] getInvalidPoints(boolean useDiagonal,
                     boolean useFittingErrors)
        Obtains error points, defined as those points in the fit that lies outside the fitting line, taking into account the errors in the slope and y value in x equal to 0.
        Parameters:
        useDiagonal - True to use the diagonal to check for errors in the rectangle error region of each point, false to use individual lengths of x and y errors.
        useFittingErrors - True to use fitting errors for y axis, false to use original y errors. False is commonly used here.
        Returns:
        An array of integer values representing the point indexes that lies outside the fitting line. Array is ordered by descent order of error, so the first point will be the worst fitted one. You can then eliminate it, repeat the fit, and check for more points outside the new fit. Null is returned if no point lies outside the fit.

      • getInvalidPointsErrors

        public double[] getInvalidPointsErrors(boolean useDiagonal,
                              boolean useFittingErrors)
        Obtains error points, defined as those points in the fit that lies outside the fitting line, taking into account the errors in the slope and y value in x equal to 0. This method returns a value proportional to the discrepancies between the fitting line and the point location.
        Parameters:
        useDiagonal - True to use the diagonal to check for errors in the rectangle error region of each point, false to use individual lengths of x and y errors.
        useFittingErrors - True to use fitting errors for y axis, false to use original y errors. False is commonly used here.
        Returns:
        An array of double values representing the errors of the points that lies outside the fitting line. First value corresponds to the point with the maximum fitting error.

      • getMaximumCorrelation

        public MeasureElement[] getMaximumCorrelation(LinearFit.MAX_CORRELATION mc,
                                     double minV,
                                     double maxV,
                                     double step)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Searches for the maximum correlation in the input data by modifying the range of that data (x or y values) and considering only points with x or y greater or lower than a given range of values.
        Parameters:
        mc - A value indication which variable will be used to modify the range of the input data contained in this instance. In case of using, for instance, to take points with y greater than a given value, the search for maximum correlation will take all points which y coordinate greater than the value specified in the next input values, for which an interation will be made.
        minV - The minimum value for the variable to be modified. In the previous example, the first y value to be used to take, in the first iteration, all points with y greater than this value.
        maxV - The maximum value for the variable to be modified. In the previous example, the last y value to be used to take, in the last iteration, all points with y greater than this value.
        step - The step in the search to go from the minimum to the maximum values.
        Returns:
        Two objects representing the measured point of the maximum correlation in x axis, and in y axis.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
